title._content: Champion racehorse Bernborough, being ridden by Billy Nielsen, in the early days of his racing career

description._content: Photographer: Unidentified Location: Unidentified Date: Undated Description: Bay horse bred in Queensland in 1939 by Emborough (GB) from Bern Maid (AUS). Bernborough did his early racing in Toowoomba (QLD) but was to emerge from his humble beginnings to become one of Australia s greatest-ever racehorses, winning many of his races with a brilliant sprint from well back in the field. An unbeaten sequence of 15 wins included victories in the 1946 Newmarket Handicap (carrying 63 kgs) and the 1946 Doomben Cup (68.5 kgs). Bernborough s unbeaten run came to a controversial end when he ran a luckless fifth carrying 68 kgs in the Caulfield Cup. His racing career came to an end when he broke down at his next run, however he was retired to a successful career at stud in Kentucky (USA). He died in 1960. Career race record: 37 starts, 26 wins, 2 seconds, 1 third, 8 unplaced. View this image at the State Library of Queensland: hdl.handle.net/10462/deriv/67270 Information about State Library of Queensland’s collection: pictureqld.slq.qld.gov.au/
